dlgLine.text: Yeah?

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
So what do you think about that guy Lane?
I went back to the bar to find Alan.
About what you did to Lane...
I had a few questions...
I have the guitar strings and fuel you needed.
It's nothing. Later.

dlgLine.text: Uh-huh.

dlgAnsw.text: How did you arrive at the bar?
Have you heard any rumors about what's going on?
Anything we could do to improve this place?
Something bothering you?
Nothing right now. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Um... hey.

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
So what do you think about that guy Lane?
I went back to the bar to find Alan.
About what you did to Lane...
So, you in the mood? I've been thinking about you all day.
I have the guitar strings and fuel you needed.
Can I ask you a question?
Hey. Talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: Kay.

dlgAnsw.text: You were saying something about your mother before. Want to talk about it?
Anything you'd like to see in this place?
It's nothing - see you later.

dlgLine.text: There were, like, those fucking dead people all over the motel. So we drove back to the bar we played at, seeing as how it was the only place we knew about in this whole shitty area.

dlgAnsw.text: Do you remember where that motel was?
I had another question.
That's all for now.

dlgLine.text: Alan was driving. I wasn't really paying attention.

dlgAnsw.text: I had another question.
That's all for now.

dlgLine.text: No. We didn't even know that everything was falling to shit. Just playing music and driving to the next gig, like always. What happened, anyway? Someone play a heavy metal record backwards or something?

dlgAnsw.text: Something like that. Another question...
Ask around. We'll speak later.

dlgLine.text: It could be less lame. Also not in Texas.

dlgAnsw.text: Right. Another question...
If you're not going to take this seriously, I'm going.

dlgLine.text: No. Why? The hell kind of question is that, anyhow?

dlgAnsw.text: Apologies. I had another question.
No - sorry I asked. I'll just get out of your way then.

dlgLine.text: Not much left to tell... She remarried, divorced, then married Jesus. I started hitting the road full-time, we stopped talking, I don't really know where she is even. I haven't really thought about the 'Agatha' years in a while.

dlgAnsw.text: The 'Agatha' years?
Is that your mom's name?

dlgLine.text: Um... my name. I haven't been called Agatha since my... second band? They started calling me Aggro when I punched this chick after she slept with my deadbeat boyfriend. That was also the end of the second band, coincidentally.
Weird... I don't know the last time I talked about that with someone. I must like you or something.

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
Thanks for sharing. We'll talk more later.

dlgLine.text: A greenhouse might be nice. Even a ghetto-style sheet plastic type would work wonders for speeding up the process for some of the plants and seedlings.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll see what I can do. Another question...
I'll consider it. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Um...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -
- New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Who?

dlgAnsw.text: The DJ.
Curly hair. Wears glasses. Um... interesting personality.

dlgLine.text: Who?

dlgAnsw.text: The DJ.
Curly hair. Wears glasses. Um... interesting personality.

dlgLine.text: Oh, him. Yeah. What about him?

dlgAnsw.text: Can't believe I'm doing this - he wants to know if you're interested in him.
I'm being a pal. Trying to make a love connection - what do you say?
To the point - he's incredibly eager to get naked with you. You down?

dlgLine.text: Oh, that guy. What about him?

dlgAnsw.text: You should make a move on him before someone else does.
He's such a... interesting guy. Don't you think?
He's crazy about you. Haven't you noticed?

dlgLine.text: Ah ha ha ha... Oh, you're not - oh, you are. Look, I know it's the end of the world and all, but, um, pretty sure I can do better.

dlgAnsw.text: But you're a perfect match - he likes music, you play music - math, etc.
He'll practically worship you.
Like who?
Okay. I'll let him know you're not interested.

dlgLine.text: I know you're a dude and, like, dudes have this idea that women can be won over, but no, we kind of know the second we see a guy if we're going to sleep with him or not. It's the end of the world - I don't have to keep that secret anymore.

dlgAnsw.text: So... thumbs up or down?
Okay. I'll let him know you're not interested.

dlgLine.text: I don't know... Maybe I've already got someone in mind. Does it matter?

dlgAnsw.text: But Lane - he's... such a guy with nice parts and such.
This guy will treat you like a goddess.
Okay. I'll let him know you're not interested.

dlgLine.text: That'd be a no, dude.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll let Lane know you're not interested.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, that'd be for the best. Sorry I didn't have better news for you.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro seems to be done with this conversation.>

dlgLine.text: He's not really my type. Oh, sure, I'm sure he'd probably be eager to please and all, but then he'd probably want to talk about my process and nerdy music shit. And I'm not really attracted to him.

dlgAnsw.text: It might be the end of the world - can't be too picky.
He's such a sweet guy though.
I'll let Lane know you're not interested.

dlgLine.text: Feel free to offer him a vag to cry on if you feel that way, but I'm going to keep my pants securely on around that guy. He's all yours.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll let Lane know you're not interested.

dlgLine.text: Was he back?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes and no... He made it back, but he must have been bit. He was already dead.

dlgLine.text: Oh... Did you at least, you know... take care of him?

dlgAnsw.text: Yeah.
No, sorry. We left rather than risk it.
I handled it.

dlgLine.text: Thanks. I... Um... Like just thinking of him walking around like those things, it just wouldn't be right.

dlgAnsw.text: He left this note for you.

dlgLine.text: You mean he's still out there, just doomed to walk around and... that just doesn't seem right. Not a bit.

dlgAnsw.text: He left you this note.

dlgLine.text: Huh... Wrote me something, huh? Let's see what he...
<sniff>Stupid jerk... Getting yourself killed... I should, uh... I should go. Thanks for... this.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Damn it... why he have to go and be so stupid? I guess I'll never get to tell him off about this. Just leaving me on my own... <sniff>damn him. Thanks for going and all, but I need a moment to just be angry at everything.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro doesn't seem to want to talk at the moment.>

dlgLine.text: Bastard had it coming...

dlgAnsw.text: I'm totally on your side on this one.
No one goes around beating up other people in my shelter! Half-rations for a week.
Usually I'd have to dole out a punishment... but I'm going to go easy on you given your past cooperation.

dlgLine.text: Good! 'Cause that sonuvabitch was seriously getting pervy. No matter what I said, it just did not get through to that ratty fanboy brain of his. So I explained it to his ribs and told them to pass it on.

dlgAnsw.text: I think he got the message. But try not to do it again, okay?
That's a freebie - no more fighting in here. Understood?

dlgLine.text: Yeah, yeah... I got ya. Glad you have my back.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro seems to have ended the conversation.>

dlgLine.text: What? For rib-tickling that perv? This is bullshit! I can't believe you're taking his side. Ugh... get outta my way.
Oh, and get raped by bears! Dick.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro seems to have ended the conversation.>

dlgLine.text: Oh? Well... um, cool. He had it coming - you do understand that, right? But I realize you have to make examples of people or something, so thanks for not making one out of me. A lot.

dlgAnsw.text: I think he got the message. But try not to do it again, okay?
That's a freebie - no more fighting in here. Understood?

dlgLine.text: Yes! I'll get set up in the morning and start playing after everyone's shift ends... Of course, I won't be available to work tomorrow, but it's going to be worth it.
Guitar buzzing, sweaty shirts, heads nodding - going to be the most alive this place has ever seemed.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro opens the pack and examines the strings.>

dlgLine.text: Oh, jeez... Look, like I told you - that was a one time thing. Just accept that and be cool about it. If the internet were still around you'd be getting high-fives from like all kinds of creepy music nerds. Don't be clingy, okay?

dlgAnsw.text: Okay. If you say so.
Aw, c'mon - just one more time? Please?
But... I love you.

dlgLine.text: Cool... Well, see ya later.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro digs through her pockets for a cigarette and ignores you.>

dlgLine.text: Ugh... You know what's worse than asking for sex? Begging for sex! This was totally a mistake - sorry we fucked, okay, dude? Get lost or something.

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro digs through her pockets for a cigarette and ignores you.>

dlgLine.text: <Laughs>You... what? Are you serious? Have you ever, like, been in love before? We fucked, dude - get over it. Man... clearly I know how to pick 'em. <Laughs>

dlgAnsw.text: <Aggro digs through her pockets for a cigarette and ignores you.>

dlgLine.text: If it can be smoked, I'll take it. Cigars, pot, whatever. Not like I'm worried about lung cancer anymore.

dlgAnsw.text: Here's a cigar.
Here's a bag of pot.
I'll let you know if I have any.

dlgLine.text: Thanks. These make me feel fancy. And I never know when I'll run out of smokes.

dlgAnsw.text: You're welcome.
Enjoy.

dlgLine.text: <Inhales the bag> Yup. Been needing this a lot lately.

dlgAnsw.text: Hope it helps.
Winners don't use drugs. Except when they really need to.
